intro: Hornstedtia lepicarpa, commonly known as the smooth-seeded hornstedtia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its fruit is a dry, smooth-seeded schizocarp, which splits into two one-seeded parts upon maturity. Hornstedtia lepicarpa is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
